#labels Featured
= A Quick Tour =

== Compiling ulib on Linux ==
  # Untar/svn checkout the source.
  # cd ulib_src_dir/
  # make
  Now we have all necessary headers and libraries under include/ and lib/ respectively.
----
  Note: pre-compiled binaries for Windows can be found under the download tab.
----

= Examples =

== The Hello-world for Aligned Hash Map ==
{{{
//
// intmap.cpp
//

#include <stdio.h>
#include <ulib/alignhash.h>  // with ulib/ prefix

using namespace ulib;   // namespace for all ulib containers

int main()
{
        align_hash_map<int,int> intmap;  // define a int-to-int map

        intmap[1] = 2;
        intmap[2] = 3;

        printf("intmap[1] = %d\n", intmap[1]);
        printf("intmap[2] = %d\n", intmap[2]);

        return 0;
}
}}}

Compile above code with g++ -I path_to_ulib_include intmap.cpp -o intmap. The program output should look like this:
{{{
intmap[1] = 2
intmap[2] = 3
}}}
